did.unittitle: Haigwood, John Henry (1919-1995): Interview and memoir

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PRISONER OF WAR EXPERIENCES IN WORLD WAR II Haigwood, army infantryman, discusses his experiences as a Japanese prisoner of war: pre-WWII enlistment and training; service in the Philippines, Japanese attack on Pearl Habor and the Philippines; combat, capture on Corregidor Island; internment at Camp Cabanatuan and Mukden in Manchuria, treatment and conditions, work in steel machinery and tanning factories; liberation by the Russian Army and return to the U.S.

4 tapes, 287 mins., 63 pp. Interview by Glenn Kniss, 1985 RESTRICTED: May be read and quoted but cannot be published or reproduced. No bound copy, only manuscript copy in collateral file. See collateral file

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: RESTRICTED: May be read and quoted but cannot be published or reproduced. No bound copy, only manuscript copy in collateral file.
